subject: Art & Design
title: The Serial Position Effect: First and Last Win
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Serial Position Effect: First and Last Win.

hook.text: Read a list of 20 words. You'll remember the first few and the last few. The middle? Mostly gone.

buildup.text: The serial position effect combines primacy (first items) and recency (last items). Both stick; the middle fades.

discovery.text: In navigation menus, the first and last items get the most clicks. Middle items are often overlooked.

twist.text: That's why 'Home' is first and 'Contact' or 'Settings' is last in most apps. Position isn't arbitrary.

climax.text: Amazon puts the 'Buy Now' button in a prime position. The most important action is never buried in the middle.

punchline.text: First impressions matter. Last impressions linger. Middle ones? Good luck.

quiz.question: What does the serial position effect predict about navigation menus?
options: First and last items get the most attention; middle items are overlooked
Middle items are clicked most often
